N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 441.23 - Tobacco product and non-prescribed or non-approved inhaling device use prohibition

State Regulations
(a) Use of tobacco products by staff or
residents or visitors on the facility grounds is prohibited. (b) Tobacco products in the possession of a
resident of such a facility are contraband and must be confiscated by agency
staff. (c) For the purposes of this
section: (1)

Use of tobacco
products
means the lighting, chewing, ingestion or smoking of any
tobacco product. (2)

Tobacco products
include but are not limited to cigarettes, cigars, pipe tobacco, chewing or dipping tobacco. (3)

Facility grounds
means
any building, structure, and surrounding grounds contained within a facility's
legally defined property boundaries as registered in a county clerk's office
and any vehicle used to transport residents of an institution, group residence, group home or agency operated boarding home. (d) Use of inhaling devices that are
otherwise not prescribed or approved by a medical professional are prohibited
for all staff, residents and visitors on the facility grounds of an
institution, group residence, group home or agency operated boarding home, as
defined in section
441.2
of this Part. (e) Unauthorized inhaling devices, as
described in subdivision (d) of this section in the possession of a resident of
such facility is contraband and must be confiscated by agency staff. Notes
